org.jboss.msc.txn

Interface ExecuteContext<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the result type of the associated task
    All Superinterfaces:
    ReportableContext, WorkContext<T>

    public interface ExecuteContext<T>
extends WorkContext<T>
    Context for a task that may also create new tasks.
    Author:
    David M. Lloyd, Flavia Rainone, Richard Opalka

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cancelled()
      Acknowledge the cancellation of this task.
      boolean isCancelRequested()
      Determine if this task has been requested to be cancelled.
      <T> TaskBuilder<T> newTask()
      Adds a task without an executable component to transaction.
      <T> TaskBuilder<T> newTask(Executable<T> task)
      Adds a task with an executable component to transaction.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jboss.msc.txn.WorkContext

        complete, complete

      • Methods inherited from interface org.jboss.msc.txn.ReportableContext

        addProblem, addProblem, addProblem, addProblem, addProblem, addProblem

    • Method Detail

      • isCancelRequested

        boolean isCancelRequested()
        Determine if this task has been requested to be cancelled.
        Returns:
        true if cancel was requested, false otherwise

      • cancelled

        void cancelled()
        Acknowledge the cancellation of this task. Before calling this method task must ensure everything it did (if anything) was reverted. Child tasks are excluded from the acknowledgement, these are considered autonomous entities.

      • newTask

        <T> TaskBuilder<T> newTask(Executable<T> task)
                       throws IllegalStateException
        Adds a task with an executable component to transaction. If the task implements Revertible interface, the corresponding builder property will be pre-initialized.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the result value type (may be Void)
        Parameters:
        task - the task
        Returns:
        the builder for the task
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this context is not accepting new tasks

      • newTask

        <T> TaskBuilder<T> newTask()
                       throws IllegalStateException
        Adds a task without an executable component to transaction. All task components will be uninitialized.
        Returns:
        the builder for the task
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if this context is not accepting new tasks
